Posts.Content: So happy for your survival!! My wife just called and said her doc called and said recent mammogram shows calcification in both breast and a dense area of tissue in left breast. She is scared. My question does that mean breast cancer for sure?
Posts.Title: Just got diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Yes,she is Her2 Positive. She is a little frail so the doctors recommend Herceptin, no chemo and they say they will moniter her heart because of previous strokes (2) and previous irregular heartbeat. The pill proposed is a Hormonal Therapy medication. She says with her age (74) and condition she doesn`t want any more medication to make her feel more tired. She is kind of giving up and I am so depressed about it. I recently fought a stage 4 tonsil/lymphnode cancer and I want her to fight as I did. Ron (her son)
Posts.Title: Need help quickly

Posts.Content: My mother was originally diagnosed with Stage 0 Breast Cancer. She went on the doctor`s advice and had her one breast removed 3 weeks ago. She was told with a lumpectomy that she would have to have radiation and possibly chemo afterwards. The breast was removed and now she is told she is a Stage II. They give her 3 choices for treatment. (1)  Some type of pill and I can`t remember the name. (2)  Herceptin given by i.v. every 3 weeks for 15 months. (3)  Chemo once a week for 2 months. She has had a stroke and has a couple stents implanted. Of course with each choice increases chances of surviving more. They recommend the Herceptin for 15 months. My mom wants to take the pill. Has anyone taken the Herceptin and if so what were the side effects please? Anything anyone can tell me or advice will help tons.  Her son.....Ron (stage 4 cancer survivor)
Posts.Title: Need help quickly

Posts.Content: Just got a call that my mammogram showed calcification in both breast and a dense area of tissue in one breast. I`m 42 and in good shape. Does this mean I most likely have breast cancer? Thanks for the help.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer concern!!

Posts.Content: I posted this for my wife. Anyone with past experience please answer. Very very appreciated.   Ron
Posts.Title: Breast cancer concern!!

Posts.Content: My mom was diagnosed with breast cancer yesterday. She was told Stage 0 invasive. They are not sure if it is in the nodes. Choices are: Lumpectomy with 6 weeks of radiation. She was told 10 to 15% chance of returning cancer with this treatment. OR Mastectomy of the one breast. No treatment. Which would you all do? Thank you all tons.   Ron (her son)
Posts.Title: Lumpectamy or Mastectomy? HELP!

Posts.Content: My wife got a call from doctor today with recent mammogram results. She was told her left breast has a dense tissue area of concern and there is calcification in both breast. She had to rush to work right after hearing this and is very scared. Has anyone been told this and can some tell us what they think about this news? Does it mean breast cancer most likely? Ron
Posts.Title: Wife is scared!
